title: Climate Adaption of Democracy
text:
Welcome to the home of the research project, Climate Adaptation of Democracy: Climate impacts on environmental and democratic attitudes, based at the Department of Political Science, University of Copenhagen. The project is funded by the Independent Research Fund Denmark and led by  Professor Kasper M. Hansen together with  Postdoc Søren Damsbo-Svendsen and  Senior Researcher Morten A. Dahl Larsen from the Danish Meteorological Institute (DMI).
The project investigates the impacts of adverse climate events on democratic institutions and attempts to answer the following research question: How do adverse local climate events affect citizens’ attitudes towards democracy and the green transition, and what strategies for communication can help create effects that are environmentally and democratically sustainable?
